text: I wouldnt use a HubSpot CTA for that.
I would use a button or link and then track it with a custom event
The CTAs work by redirecting you. This isnt ideal for popover items.

Is there a way to set a  background image per page, or per flexible column, or module group and have that image be selectable when a non technical user is editing a page?
I could do it at the module level, but then it would be hard to have a *single image* that take up   the background of multiple modules.
you can but you might have to make a custom module that adds a style tag. There used to be the hubl module which was great for that. but in DM2 it’s gone.

i’m working in a portal that has a lot of CTAs and created a custom module with a CTA selector field. it looks like the field isn’t pulling in CTAs created before ~11/2017. is there a known limitation to this field?
I made those changes before you sent the gif above so I was very worried there was another case I missed. Happy to hear it’s working :smile:

kind of annoying thing - New global modules - they are no longer tied to the original module they are based on so if you update the original you do not get the fields added in the global version.

The current approach to Global modules feels disjointed

Global modules in general I think need some TLC
We still have to create them by adding them to a template, there is no interface for it otherwise. Also marketers have no way of editing global modules, other than the design manager - which is “scary” to them.

I’ve been jury rigging global modules lately by just having custom modules hooked up to a hubdb table. Then I put a template level override in there, like “If this field is filled out it will override the default content.”
It’s still a little scary because of the lack of a revision history
it’s a good work around. just sucks we have to use it
fun-fact I’ve heard rumor HubDB is getting a revision history - no idea when though
